com.eatthepath.jeospatial.util

Class SearchResults<E extends GeospatialPoint>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractQueue<E>
        • java.util.PriorityQueue<E>
          • com.eatthepath.jeospatial.util.SearchResults<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Iterable<E>, Collection<E>, Queue<E>

    public class SearchResults<E extends GeospatialPoint>
extends PriorityQueue<E>

    The SearchResults class is a fixed-size PriorityQueue subclass that may or may not accept points that are offered to it based on several criteria. SearchResults instances are always created with a reference to a query point and a prescribed size; when points are offered via the add(E) or addAll(java.util.Collection<? extends E>) methods, the SearchResults instance will accept the point if and only if the following conditions are met:

    1. The SearchResults instance contains fewer points than its maximum capacity or the offered point is closer to the query point than the most distant point already in the queue.
    2. No maximum distance has been specified or the offered point falls within the maximum allowable distance from the query point.
    3. No search criteria have been specified or the offered point meets the given search criteria.

    SearchResults objects use an internal reverse geospatial distance comparator; this ensures that the point at the head of the queue is always the most distant point from the query point.

    Author:
    Jon Chambers
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • SearchResults

        public SearchResults(GeospatialPoint queryPoint,
             int maxSize)
        Constructs a new search result collector that collects up to maxSize points.
        Parameters:
        queryPoint - the point to use as the origin of all distance calculations
        maxSize - the maximum number of points this result set may contain

      • SearchResults

        public SearchResults(GeospatialPoint queryPoint,
             int maxSize,
             double maxDistance)
        Constructs a new search result collector that collects up to maxSize points that fall within the given distance to the query point.
        Parameters:
        queryPoint - the point to use as the origin of all distance calculations
        maxSize - the maximum number of points this result set may contain
        maxDistance - the maximum allowable distance from the query point; points more distant than this threshold will always be rejected

      • SearchResults

        public SearchResults(GeospatialPoint queryPoint,
             int maxSize,
             SearchCriteria<E> criteria)
        Constructs a new search result collector that collects up to maxSize points that meet the given search criteria.
        Parameters:
        queryPoint - the point to use as the origin of all distance calculations
        maxSize - the maximum number of points this result set may contain
        criteria - the search criteria to be met by all points included in this result set; points that do not meet the search criteria will always be rejected

      • SearchResults

        public SearchResults(GeospatialPoint queryPoint,
             int maxSize,
             double maxDistance,
             SearchCriteria<E> criteria)
        Constructs a new search result collector that collects up to maxSize points that fall within the given distance to the query point and meet the given search criteria.
        Parameters:
        queryPoint - the point to use as the origin of all distance calculations
        maxSize - the maximum number of points this result set may contain
        maxDistance - the maximum allowable distance from the query point; points more distant than this threshold will always be rejected
        criteria - the search criteria to be met by all points included in this result set; points that do not meet the search criteria will always be rejected

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public boolean add(E point)
        Offers a point to this result set. The point will be added only if it meets all criteria provided at construction time and if the search result set is not yet full or the offered point is closer to the query point than the most distant point currently in the result set.
        Specified by:
        add in interface Collection<E extends GeospatialPoint>
        Specified by:
        add in interface Queue<E extends GeospatialPoint>
        Overrides:
        add in class PriorityQueue<E extends GeospatialPoint>
        Parameters:
        point - the point to offer to this result set
        Returns:
        true if the point was added to this result set or false otherwise

      • addAll

        public boolean addAll(Collection<? extends E> points)
        Offers all of the points in the given collection to this result set.
        Specified by:
        addAll in interface Collection<E extends GeospatialPoint>
        Overrides:
        addAll in class AbstractQueue<E extends GeospatialPoint>
        Parameters:
        points - the collection of points to add to this queue
        Returns:
        true if any of the offered points were added to this result set or false otherwise
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified collection is this result set
        See Also:
        add(GeospatialPoint)

      • getLongestDistanceFromQueryPoint

        public double getLongestDistanceFromQueryPoint()
        Returns the distance from the query point provided at construction time to the most distant point in this result set.
        Returns:
        the distance, in meters, from the query point to the most distant point in this result set, or Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY if this result set is empty

      • toSortedList

        public List<E> toSortedList()
        Returns a list of the points in this result set sorted in order of increasing distance from the query point provided at construction time. The result set itself is not modified by calls to this method.
        Returns:
        a sorted list of the points in this result set
